entry.tran: (常指因见到或闻到食物而)分泌唾液，流口水，垂涎
entry.def: When people or animals salivate, they produce a lot of saliva in their mouth, often as a result of seeing or smelling food.

example.ex: Any dog will salivate when presented with food.
example.tran: 所有狗看到食物都会流口水。

entry.def: If you say that someone is salivating over something such as the chance to make a lot of money, you are emphasizing that you disapprove of their pleasure or eagerness.

example.ex: Johnson was salivating over the millions he stood to make...
example.tran: 约翰逊对快要到手的几百万垂涎欲滴。

example.ex: American companies were salivating at the juicy contracts for rebuilding Kuwait that were likely to come their way.
example.tran: 重建科威特的合同利润丰厚，对于他们有望分得的那一杯羹，美国各公司都垂涎欲滴。
